name: gamma-hexachlorocyclohexane
Reason: To predict the melting point of gamma-hexachlorocyclohexane, we start with the basic unit cyclohexane, whose melting point is 6.5 degrees Celsius. Each chloro group we add to the compound increases the melting point due to the electron-withdrawing nature of chlorine which stabilizes the solid state and also due to the added molecular weight and resultant increase in van der Waals forces. However, the chlorines are also large substituents and can introduce strain and disrupt symmetry which lessens the increase in melting point compared to smaller halogens. Let us consider each chloro group to raise the melting point by (112.5 - 6.5) / 6 = 17.67 degrees Celsius. Therefore, for the six chloro groups, we expect an increase in melting point of approximately 17.67 * 6.
